p: The involvement of potassium channels in the vasorelaxant effect was assessed following the experimental procedure previously detailed, with some variations [54]. Endothelium-intact rings were incubated with the Ca2+-activated potassium channels, TEA (10−2M; n = 6), the selective voltage-activated potassium channel (Kv) blocker, 4-AP (10−4M; n = 6), the selective inwardly-rectifying potassium channel blocker, BaCl2 (10−4M; n = 6), and the selective ATP-sensitive potassium channel blocker, glybenclamide (10−5M; n = 6) for 20 min prior to contraction with Phen (1 μM), then, the cumulative concentration–response curves of AcEO were constructed and compared with those obtained with untreated rings.
